WorkItem.Description:
Firstly, I would like to say thanks for a great product. I am just starting off with DDD and WPF, and the samples are a real help.
 
Anyway, I am wondering what is the best way to display elliptical markers?
 
I have a data set of (x,y) points. At each point I would like to add a marker (say a small cross), and surrounding each point I would also like to draw an ellipse. The ellipse for each point will have a different shape (height/width/rotation), which is a function of the (x,y) coordinates.
 
I would also like to specify the ellipses in "drawing units" so that they rescale appropriately. So the question really is: Can I use an elliptical marker? If so how? Do I have to create an elliptical marker or ellipse shape sub class from an existing class.
 
Just really looking for your thoughts / places to start. Any advice would be appreciated.
 
I have attached a picture showing (sort of what I would like).
 
Keep up the good work.
 
Cheers,
Brian

Comments.Message:
Hi Brian,
in the closest time I'll try to create a sample for you.
The only thing I wanted to add is that it is better to post such posts to Discussions page, because there I will be notified about new messages.
Best regards,
Mikhail.

Thanks for the reply Mikhail, and for your help.

And I will put similar posts in the discussions page: I realised as soon as I posted this message that it was on the wrong forum. Oops.

Hi Brian,
I've created a sample for you.
It is located in 'Source code' page, in the changeset 28750 (http://dynamicdatadisplay.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/view/28750), in Nightly/DynamicDataDisplay.sln/DevSamples solution folder/NewMarkersSample project/RotatedEllipsePage.
Screenshot of this sample is added to our screenshot gallery - http://dynamicdatadisplay.codeplex.com/Wiki/View.aspx?title=Development-time%20screens.
Hope this is what you need.

Best regards,
Mikhail.
